pullRequest.body:
Define class of field extensions with exponent.
Show that if exponent exists then the extension is purely inseparable.
Define the exponent of an element.
Prove basic results.


---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> List.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

nodes.body:
### PR summary [1d8d36a359](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/21372/commits/1d8d36a3591eb25dfc2c305d787491f1513d04f9)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
| `Mathlib.FieldTheory.PurelyInseparable.Exponent` (new file)|1566|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ HasExponent`
`+ algebraMap_elemReduct_eq`
`+ algebraMap_elemReduct_eq'`
`+ elemExponent`
`+ elemExponent_def`
`+ elemExponent_def'`
`+ elemExponent_eq_zero_of_charZero`
`+ elemExponent_eq_zero_of_mem_range`
`+ elemExponent_le_exponent`
`+ elemExponent_le_of_pow_mem`
`+ elemExponent_le_of_pow_mem'`
`+ elemExponent_min`
`+ elemExponent_min'`
`+ elemReduct`
`+ exponent`
`+ exponent_def`
`+ exponent_def'`
`+ exponent_min`
`+ exponent_min'`
`+ hasExponent_iff'`
`+ hasExponent_of_finiteDimensional`
`+ instance [HasExponent K L] : IsPurelyInseparable K L`
`+ minpoly_eq`
`+ minpoly_eq'`
`+ minpoly_natDegree_eq`
`+ minpoly_natDegree_eq'`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>
I'm still not sure if I should rather use `[ExpChar K p]` instance-implicit parameter.
@acmepjz Thanks for the review! Changed as suggested.

I removed versions with `[ExpChar K p]` as they are always `ringExpChar.eq K p ▸ ...` so it does not make sense to have them.
I think API using `ringExpChar K` is clean.

> I removed versions with `[ExpChar K p]` as they are always `ringExpChar.eq K p ▸ ...` so it does not make sense to have them. I think API using `ringExpChar K` is clean.

That's fine. Would you like to add a remark to docstring explaining that how to convert `ringExpChar K` case to `[ExpChar K p]` case?

@jcommelin I hope I addressed your comments. I'm still curious what would be an example of usage of this new API where the trick with substitution using `ringExpChar.eq E p` would not work or would be inconvenient?
As soon as you have a `K` and an `L` with the same characteristic, and you want to view them both as algebras over the same `ZMod p`.

:v: mistarro can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).
bors r+

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/13666668893/job/38209211395)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/13666668893/job/38209211738)
Thank you for your hard work! Unfortunately, I have no free time these days for reviewing the remaining parts yet. I think there can be some improvements.
Thank you very much! I think now it's good to go besides some style suggestions.
You correctly use `ringExpChar` in the definitions. But please use `[ExpChar K p]` in the api results about those definitions.

```suggestion
noncomputable def elemEncode (a : L) : ℕ × K :=
  Classical.choose <| Prod.exists'.mpr (minpoly_eq_X_pow_sub_C K (ringExpChar K) a)
```

(untested)

See also the comment I left at Zulip for a possibly better approach.

Maybe for this result (or another `exponent_def'`) you should use an input `p` together with `[ExpChar K p]`.

Also, you missed a result that if `e < exponent K L`, then there exists an `a` such that `a ^ ringExpChar K ^ e` is not in `K`.
Created versions with `ExpChar` for some theorems and added the result you suggested.
This note is obsolete as your new definition makes elemExponent equals 0 for characteristic 0 case.
I think this should called `elemExponent_eq_zero_of_XXX`, same as the next result.
I think this should called `hasExponent_of_finiteDimensional`.
I think this is an intermediate result. Is it possible to inline the proof of it into `elemExponent_le_exponent`?

I forgot that this should be called `HasExponent.has_exponent`. Also, since the following several results uses primed version for `ExpChar K p`, so maybe we should switch the `has_exponent` and `has_exponent'`:
```suggestion
class HasExponent : Prop where
  has_exponent : ∃ e, ∀ a, a ^ ringExpChar K ^ e ∈ (algebraMap K L).range

/-- Version with `[ExpChar K p]`. -/
theorem HasExponent.has_exponent' (p : ℕ) [ExpChar K p] [HasExponent K L] :
    ∃ e, ∀ a, a ^ p ^ e ∈ (algebraMap K L).range :=
  ringExpChar.eq K p ▸ has_exponent
```
The following codes need changes accordingly.

Maybe
```suggestion
  `a ^ ringExpChar K ^ e ∈ K` for all `a ∈ L`.
```

Maybe
```suggestion
    rw [RingHom.map_pow, algebraMap_elemReduct_eq, ← pow_mul, ← pow_add,
```
I think non-terminal `simp` is not allowed in mathlib code. Could you try replace it by the output of `simp?` which looks like `simp only [XXX]` ?
This `open Classical` is not necessary? (untested)
Do you think results` elemExponent_(def|min)[']` are useful?
Ok, will add them.

I wonder if we should define the degree, sepDegree and insepDegree of an algebraic element; it seems you need the degree to define the absolute trace. You need to take `Nat.log` to get from `insepDegree` to `elemExponent` though.

> I wonder if we should define the degree, sepDegree and insepDegree of an algebraic element; it seems you need the degree to define the absolute trace. You need to take `Nat.log` to get from `insepDegree` to `elemExponent` though.

I think it's reasonable, but maybe not in this PR. The definition of `elemExponent` could be changed to the smallest natural number `e` such that `a ^ ringExpChar K ^ e ∈ separableClosure K L`; in this case the `IsPurelyInseparable` assumption could be changed to `Algebra.IsAlgebraic`.

Note that it is just respective degree of the minimal polynomial. I think definitions stated in this PR are easier to work with, see for example the result `minpoly_eq`. Defining `elemExponent` just from degree would add complexity. And I need `elemReduct` for proceeding with the frobenius map.
This lemma can be stated in terms of `[ExpChar K p]` to make it easier to apply.
Please create a constructor for this class that *does* assume `[ExpChar K p]`.

> Please create a constructor for this class that _does_ assume `[ExpChar K p]`.

... which I think is to add a `@[mk_iff]` before the `class HasExponent : Prop where`, and add a `hasExponent_iff'` which uses `[ExpChar K p]` (in this case I think `ringExpChar.eq K p ▸` is not convenient).
I would prefer if the version that uses `ExpChar` is the main one, without the `'`.
Once again, this can be stated using `[ExpChar]`.
Idem dito.

Initially I did like this for each result but all the proofs were just `ringExpChar.eq K p ▸ <corresponding result>`, so I removed and commented on it in the file docstring. Do you think it's worth duplicating (almost) everything if the usage in the context where `[ExpChar K p]` is available is only to do above substitution?

Yes, because the substitution trick only works in "simple" contexts, like the API lemmas in this file.
Users of this file will eventually be thankful it is written with the generality of `[ExpChar K p]`.

(Also please don't resolve conversations before people have a chance to read and reply to your response.)

Please also provide variants for these lemmas. After that, this seems ready for merging.

bors d+

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(FieldTheory/PurelyInseparable): introduce exponent
